posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: ↑
Oct 16, 2019
Genuine question here. While I see pretty much all builds with HiPS (including a couple of my own) also maxing Hide and Move Silently, why? (Other than the qualifying levels needed for SD, of course.) If you can HiPS at will and as often as you like, why use more skill points in Hide and MS that you could use elsewhere? And if your enemy has True Seeing, it doesn't matter a fig which you have anyway. Maybe MS makes sense, but Hide? Am I just missing something glaringly obvious? Wouldn't be the first time, after all...
HIPS gives the ability to use the Hide skill successfully even if your enemy can see you. Normally you have to be out of sight before entering stealth successfully, by running behind a corner etc.
So even if you can use HIPS, you still need good stealth skills to actually disappear out of sight and avoid being detected.

The Hide skill is opposed by the Spot skill and the Move silently skill is opposed by the Listen skill.

True seeing pierces stealth and invisibility spells and makes it almost impossible to go undetected. Some PWs  use a modified version of the True seeing spell that detects invisibility and adds a bonus to the Spot skill, just so you don't ruin stealth altogether. This doesn't affect the TS item property and the TS from creature skins though, so a dragon with vanilla properties will see you, no matter what.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Yes, it is scaled in the sense that you get better at hiding with better stealth skills. HIPS makes it possible to hide "in plain sight", but to succeed with not being detected you need good stealth skills.

Now there is a "but" here. And that is how detection works; how often the hide, move silently, spot and listen skills are rolled, and how often they are checked.
The skills in question are rolled once every round (6 sec), but the results of the rolls are checked more often:
Player detects stealth 5 times per second
NPC detects stealth every 4 seconds

This means that there can be a short time window before your skills (the rolls) are checked and you can be detected.
This raises the question if spamming HIPS can make it possible to stall detection, at least by NPCs.
I have not tested this on a low stealth build because my stealth builds already have high stealth skills.
In several PWs they have  a "Cool down timer" (e.g. 6 seconds) on HIPS to prevent HIPS from being spammed.

My bottom line is that if you want to use stealth, you also want the skills to avoid being detected in the long run (long meaning anything more than a few seconds here)

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Greetings all.
I have spent some 5-6 months playing more arcane casters since I originally posted this.
I have updated the build with increased proficiency with casters and play-testing the build to level 26. 

I have chosen to focus on getting level 20 Sorc as soon as possible to enhance play-ability, as the ability to level up this build is much easier by focusing on spell-casting early, once proficiency is obtained a mixture of features are then added, including HiPS (level 22), Epic Mage Armor (level 25), 'Undispellability' (level 26), Epic Warding (level 31) and Monk Speed (level 33) 

I trialed HiPS at level 8 but it was much less effective than more powerful spells more often. I presumed Monk Speed would be the same.

I have also included a suggested spell list, based on the spells I found useful.
One will notice level 2, level 4, level 5 and level 9 have too many spells that are useful, and not enough known spells for the sorcerer. 
Levels 4 and 9 are the worst in that they have so many useful spells but not enough space.

This can be partially mitigated with Craft Wand, Sequencers and Scrolls (or taking Craft Scroll as a feat)
The spells will have lower caster levels but at least you can cast them.
For Level 2 and Level 4 spells, Dismissal, Animate Dead, a wand of the spell of interest can be crafted during level ups, then spellbooks can be shifted later.
Level 5 and 9 spells, Sequencers and Scrolls
